lines.text: May I... buy you a drink?
I don't see why not. I'm on the pill.
You could be walking around lucky, and not even know it.
The 4 horse! Nobody bets the 4 horse, Trotter. The 4 horse is a joke. They let little kiddies on the 4 horse to have their picture taken."
She has very long legs.
Thanks. They go from my ass all the way to the floor.

[after Trotter won but Looney didn't even bet]
I'd hate to have to walk around this track with seven hundred dollars cash.
Seven hundred and TEN - and you'll never have that problem, because the only reason I won is that you didn't bet! You are the unluckiest person in the world!
Am not!
Am!
Am not!
Am!
[pulling out his racing form]
Who do you like in the second?
The six horse looks pretty good...

[dramatically crosses out the six horse on his racing form]
You got a brother?
In Cleveland.
Call him up, ask him who he likes. I figure it's in the blood!
There's a fine line between winning and losing.
Yeah. The finish line.
You know what they say, 'Nothing ventured, nothing... ventured.'
[Watching toteboard go from 40-1 to 8-1]
Probably some coke dealer went nuts again.
She's pert. If you like pert.
Gimme forty-eight $50 win tickets on the three horse in the seventh race.

[starts pushing buttons]
So, I have to give you forty-eight $50 win tickets on the three horse in the seventh race...
Wait! Wait! How much does forty-eight $50 win tickets on the three horse in the seventh race *pay*?
Let's see... forty-eight $50 win tickets on the three horse in the seventh race at...
[whistles]
...twenty-nine to one will pay you approximately...
[moves his lips and mumbles to himself while figuring]
...sixty-nine thousand dollars!

[puts $2400 in cash on the counter]
Let it ride!
What's the number?
[smile fades away]
It's a house rule! You've got to give me a number!

[puts the box with $69,000 in cash on the counter]
Let it ride!
Is it all there?
I took out a little for the wife and a few things, but basically, yeah, it's all there!
I can't give you win tickets for that! That's over 1300 win tickets! It will jam up the machine!
[leans forward]
The counting room!
[Last lines]
Why are they cheering?
I'm having a VERY good day.
Stay on the track!
The horse can't hear you!
Eight's the one, I'd stake my life on it.
They've got a $2 minimum bet.
[Discussing Trotter]
All kind of balls...
One of his is crystal.
I'm sure glad I didn't bet.
You didn't bet?
I woulda had a heart attack.

[after realizing he has just one a heap of money while watching the race among the social elite]
Did I win? Did I WIN? SON-OF-A-BITCH! GOD LIKES ME! HE REALLY, REALLY, LIKES ME! WHAT A DAY! WHAT A FABULOUS DAY!

[following Trotter as he leaves the betting booth]
Hey, Trotter! I got an idea on how we can make some money. We take the tape, right. We play it for the trainer. With what he just made on that last race, maybe he wouldn't mind slippin' us like five grand...
...I already got rid of the tape.

[drops to his knees]
AAAHHHHHH!
I just saved you from a lengthy jail sentence.
I'LL GET YOU FOR THIS!
[slams his money on the betting counter]
Fifty bucks on Junebug to win! It's the same name as my cat.

[waiting for the race result to be announced]
I've done nothing to deserve this anguish.
Down in front, you big lug!

[spins around]
Who said that?
[dead silence and no movement in the crowd]
These other nags are gonna die in the starting gate!

[seeing Trotter coming to bet $68,000]
I may faint. Don't worry. We got full medical coverage. I'll be ok.
